channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Structure Fire; INC#1611; 10:27PM; 13574 W Gager St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TSw37k; #Pacoima; Heavy fire showing from a detached structure (garage? converted?) to the rear of a one-story single-family home.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 E275 E298 E75 E81 E98 RA75 RA898 RA98 T75 T98; CH9; 17; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0784; 12:36PM; Haines Canyon Ave; MAP: https://bit.ly/49gXCeK; #Tujunga; Firefighters located a 19-year-old male in a remote area, with an arm injury sustained during cycling. Ground crews were unable to bring apparatus to the patient's location, therefore LAFD Air Operations utilized a hoist operation. A rescuer was lowered down to the patient to assess, treat, and prepare the patient for a hoist. LAFD Air Operations hoisted and transported the patient by air to a local hospital. Nothing further.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E24 E274 H4 H7 HA4 HA7 PB74 RA77 RA874 RH114 T74; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Aircraft Emergency - DRILL ONLY; INC#0344; 07:37AM; Burbank Airport; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VAxhVN; Burbank; Several public safety agencies are conducting a large-scale drill at Burbank Airport today, including your LAFD. In the case of an actual emergency, those who are signed up for Incident Alerts at LAFD.org/Alerts will receive these notifications. This training will better prepare first responders for responding to an aircraft emergency, and help practice interoperability between agencies with regards to communications and tactics. There is no actual Aircraft Emergency at this time.; FS 60; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; BC14 CM2 EM14 HL1 HL2; CH8; 16; Nicholas Prange

Complete - River Rescue; INC#1201; 05:38PM; Los Angeles River East of Laurel Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/YVgEchDCDax5MoUWA; #StudioCity; After being thrown a flotation device and briefly holding onto the lower portion of a 24' wooden ladder lowered by the first arriving LAFD crew along the vertical concrete wall of the Los Angeles River, the 35-year-old woman was again swept a short distance downstream by the 15 mile-per-hour flow of stormwater, before being rescued by an LAFD Rescue Helicopter crew using a hoist cable and harness. She and her LAFD rescuer have been safely hoisted aboard the aircraft where she will receive continuous in-flight care for minor injuries, including hypothermia, during direct helicopter transport to an area hospital. The woman has confirmed there were no other persons or animals with her, or known by her to be in peril.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC11 BC14 BC2 CM20 CM22 E203 E227 E235 E250 E273 E278 E288 E35 E42 E55 E56 E76 E86 E88 EM5 H4 H6 HA4 HA6 HR3 RA56 RA850 RA878 T27 T3 T35 T50 T73 T78 T88 UR88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

River Rescue; INC#1201; 05:03PM; Los Angeles River x Laurel Canyon Blvd; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/YVgEchDCDax5MoUWA; #StudioCity; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response, following a sudden rainstorm, to an adult female first discovered in the concrete-lined Los Angeles River flood control channel near Whitsett Avenue "less than knee depth" water that was moving at approximately 15 miles-per-hour. She was thrown a flotation device by responders, and is reportedly moving slowly downstream, last seen 400 yards west of Laurel Canyon Boulevard (5:28 PM), where she has reportedly been able to stand briefly, before being destabilized by the water.; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; AO1 AO2 BC1 BC2 CM20 CM22 E203 E235 E250 E273 E278 E288 E35 E42 E55 E56 E76 E88 EM5 H4 H6 HA4 HA6 HR3 RA56 RA850 RA878 T3 T35 T50 T73 T78 T88 UR88; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Greater Alarm Structure Fire - Now Out 03/23/2024 INC#1702

item.description: Greater Alarm Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1702; 11:57PM; 3051 E Wabash Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vo0etE; #BoyleHeights; 72 Firefighters took just 32 minutes (12:29 AM) to access, confine and extinguish fire within a 75' x 100' two-story commercial building containing a coin laundry and second floor living area. LAFD crews rescued an adult male and dog from the living area. One other civilian was medically evaluated. Both declined medical care. Fire cause under active investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E25 E3 E4 E95 EA1 EM1 HR3 RA2 RA25 RA3 RA803 RA900 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T1 T2 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey
item.category: Greater Alarm Structure Fire - Now Out

item.description: Complete - Rescue; INC#1211; 05:30PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; #VanNuys; Though the construction site prohibited direct access and rescue operations solely via an LAFD aerial ladder truck, firefighters were able to extend the truck's 100' aerial ladder to use a a distant high point, allowing LAFD responders to use ground ladders and a two-line rope/harness system to successfully lower the worker to safety. The 39-year-old man, who reportedly experienced a severe lower abdominal injury - possibly from a nail gun discharge, is now being medically evaluated and prepared for hospital transport by LAFD Paramedics.; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E239 E288 E39 E88 RA60 RA88 T39 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#1211; 04:41PM; 7319 N Hazeltine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ppEvu6; #VanNuys; PRELIM: Adult male construction worker (conflicting report of injury), conscious and alert, stranded on unstable scaffolding at third floor level at rear of an apartment building. As confined location prohibits access by LAFD aerial ladder truck, firefighters - including those specially trained and equipped for urban search & rescue, are preparing to use ground ladders and possibly a rope/harness system to safety remove the man. ; FS 81; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; BC10 E239 E288 E39 E88 RA60 RA88 T39 T88 UR88; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0854; 12:57PM; 745 S Stanford Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a0GAmv; #DowntownLA; *Corrected Address* Thirty-four firefighters responded to a two-story center-hallway apartment building with fire in one unit on the first floor. Crews deployed hose lines to make an aggressive interior fire attack, quickly containing the flames to just the unit of origin and eliminating the fire in 14 minutes from the time of alarm. A search of the unit, thankfully, did not reveal any occupants to be inside. Firefighters will remain on scene to set up blowers and systematically ventilate all smoke out of the building. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation. ; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E17 E209 E210 E9 RA17 RA804 SQ21 T10 T9; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0854; 12:43PM; 820 E Agatha St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TkIIOQ; #DowntownLA; Two-story apartment building with smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E17 E209 E210 E9 RA17 RA804 SQ21 T10 T9; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange
